author: uptodatedevelopers
title: ADA to Mobile Money App
description: アフリカ人の多くは、ADAを現地の通貨に交換することが困難なため、ADA暗号通貨の受け取りを拒否しています。

f6_assessments.q0: Relation to personal qualifications: Since I am actively observing the general crypto space since several years and also the projects in Project Catalyst, I have a certain understanding of what opportunities the sector has to offer and what applications could provide added value to the community. In addition to this I have an understanding of budgeting, both due to my past engagement as a treasurer in a political organisation and my current work as a project engineer, which will give me a good grasp of realistic budgeting of projects.  In addition to this, I learned some programming during my university studies, so I can comprehend the basic ideas behind a lot of the technical details. His proposal identifies a serious problem, the lack of accessibility to finance, especially to Crypto assets in many african countries. The solution to it seems simple and, if implemented correctly will be beneficial both to people in related countries and to the Cardano Ecosystem. While the product relates to the challenge, KPIs and Metrics are not explicitly mentioned thus it is difficult to say whether they align well with the challenge metrics. Same can be said for scalability (even though the defined product has the potential for being scalable).
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers seem competent according to their website and them being backed by WADA  makes it credible that these are not just claims and they are up to the challenge. Still however, the proposal is lacking some important points: While the concept is explained comprehensively, the roadmap of single steps is a bit coarse-grained and the budget does not have a rationale. The proposers are also not discussing how much resources or developers will be working on the project. Feedback: I know it is difficult to grasp the structure and the workflows of Project catalyst in the beginning. However, try reading some guides for your future proposals on what a good proposal is supposed to contain and investing the time in doing it right. A lot remains unexplained here. I am sure you are a great startup and have very good ideas, so you need to make sure that you provide a proper implementation plan if you apply for funding.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement is presented, and the product is clearly defined, this it gives this proposal a certain auditability. The Problem statement and the provided solution are clear, understandable and relatable. The only thing lacking regarding auditability is the missing metrics and KPIs. Also, the roadmap could be a bit more detailed. Feedback: Make your roadmap more detailed and add concrete metrics to your proposal that can be audited along the way of implementation.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating a solution for Africans to be able to exchange and/or receive ADA would add value to the Cardano ecosystem and drives adoption. However, this is supposed to be a Decentralized App challenge, and I don't see any indication that this is a dApp or centralized exchange service that is using Mobile Money open-source wallet API. Who hold the USD liquidity? A company? Or a collateral liquidity from users on a permissionless DEX?
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provides their team background experience and Linkedin profile on their Updev website, and further proves that the team have the capability needed to implement this proposal. Although, it would be better to specify the person in charge, so there could be accountability to who's responsible for this proposal in case anything happen when funding is approved. Unfortunately, there aren't any explanation in details regarding the budget allocation. The proposal provides the information on what they will be doing, but didn't provide technical detail on how to implement it. For example, what mobile platform would it be for? Android, iOS, Mobile Web App? What are the resources needed (e.g for database and framework/library)? By providing this details, we could then verify if the working timeline given (3 months) would be feasible or not. Creating an Android, iOS, and mobile web app at the same time will be harder than just focusing on only one platform. The proposer said that the wallet that they will create doesn't need a lot of development time, but didn't explain further in details about why and how. I gave it 2 stars mainly because lack of explanation about technical details and the budget breakdowns to justify their requested fund. It would be a 3 star if the budget is broken down accordingly, and 4 to 5 star if the technical detail is articulated clearly.
f6_assessments.q2: They provide the roadmap for 2 and 3 months, but it would be better if they add more detailed metrics/KPIs. For example, the key metrics for the first 2 months are: implementing the UI design, implementing the core functionality for sending and receiving ADAs, wallet creation with passphrase, etc. Other than that, the proposer do have a clear understandable description of said problem, and the solution they provide.  It would be helpful if they explain on how it will be transparent project, maybe by providing a GitHub repo.
f6_assessments.reply:
Feasibility Rating :   The person in charge is the legal representative of the startup, CEO Dan Baruka.

The platform that will be designed will be Mobile (Android and IOS). It won't be difficult to create both versions at the same time since for development we will be using Flutter which is an open source framework by Google for building beautiful, natively compiled, multi-platform applications from a single codebase. So we won't have to design the Android and IOS version, we will design the Android version and generate the IOS directly. We will use Mongodb as a database.
We won't really create a wallet, what we will do is integrate extensions of the wallets that already exist in our application. This is the reason why it will not take us very long.  

During this step we will focus on the detailed study and analysis of the problem of exchanging ADAs to local currencies.

We will have to carry out the following steps:
- Detailed study of the problem
- Implementation of a basic architecture
- Proposal of the graphic model to use

Fund needed: 2000 USD

Stage 1: Active Development (Up to 1 Month)

During this step we will begin the active development of the ADA To Mobile Money application.

We will take the following steps:

- Development of the Administration part
- Development of the user part

Fund needed: 8000 USD

Stage 2: Conversion solutions (Up to 3 Months of development)

- Connection of the application with a first extension of ADA wallets that already exists
- Implementation of the API of a first mobile money operator such as M-Pesa for example

Fund needed: 4000 USD

Stage 3: Testing with internal users:

First tests of the application by beta testers in order to correct the first version of the application which will be published.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think the idea of dApp that exchanges ADA to local currency as the team proposes is essential not just for Africa but for every location in the world. Personally, I think it will attract a lot of users to use it. Therefore, it impacts a lot on the Cardano ecosystem and DeFi. 
But I think the team should provide to us some key metrics or KPIs that they will aim to, this will help CA, vCA to assess that your project fits the challenge givens or not, and also measure how much your project impact to Cardano community development - it's will help to support your project to attract more voters.
f6_assessments.q1:
The idea is great and the team also has detailed information about their idea implementation, including some info about technology under the system. 
They also have enough roadmap in the scope of this proposal (only developing) and the budget is sufficient for that roadmap. 
But I think this project will meet a lot of problems, not about the technology but about the user and the surrounding environment, including the government, finance environment in Africa that affect it... hope that I can see some awarded risks and how they can get rid or face off.
f6_assessments.q2:
Lacking key metrics for assessing where the team wants to go a is it align with the challenge or not. But I think their roadmap is close enough for auditing the project because in the scope of this proposal, it is just about the publishing product feature. 
The team has a very detailed explanation about the context in Africa, then shows clearly how their app can help people to solve that problem well, including in user case and tech.
